frontmatter.title: Calculate Surface Ocean Heat using CESM2 LENS data

affiliations.name: NSF National Center for Atmospheric Research

children.value: This notebook is an adpation of a
in the NCAR gallery of the Pangeo collection
This notebook illustrates how to compute surface ocean heat content using potential temperature data from
(Community Earth System Model 2) hosted on NCAR‚Äôs GDEX.
This data is open access and is accessed via OSDF using the pelicanFS package and demonstrates how you can stream data from NCAR‚Äôs GDEX
Please refer to the first chapter of this cookbook to learn more about OSDF, pelican or pelicanFS
The python package used to stream data in this notebook
OSDF is used to stream data in this notebook

import intake
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import xarray as xr
import seaborn as sns
import re
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import dask
from dask.distributed import LocalCluster
import pelicanfs 
import cf_units as cf
Before we do any computation let us first set up a local cluster using dask

# Scale the cluster
n_workers = 5
cluster.scale(n_workers)
cluster

def change_units(ds, variable_str, variable_bounds_str, target_unit_str):
    orig_units = cf.Unit(ds[variable_str].attrs['units'])
    target_units = cf.Unit(target_unit_str)
    variable_in_new_units = xr.apply_ufunc(orig_units.convert, ds[variable_bounds_str], target_units, dask='parallelized', output_dtypes=[ds[variable_bounds_str].dtype])
    return variable_in_new_units

depth_levels_in_m = change_units(historical, 'z_t', 'z_t', 'm')
hist_temp_in_degK = change_units(historical, 'TEMP', 'TEMP', 'degK')
fut_cmip6_temp_in_degK = change_units(future_cmip6, 'TEMP', 'TEMP', 'degK')
fut_smbb_temp_in_degK = change_units(future_smbb, 'TEMP', 'TEMP', 'degK')
#
hist_temp_in_degK  = hist_temp_in_degK.assign_coords(z_t=("z_t", depth_levels_in_m['z_t'].data))
hist_temp_in_degK["z_t"].attrs["units"] = "m"
hist_temp_in_degK

children.value: Compute Ocean Heat content for ocean surface

children.label: Compute Ocean Heat content for ocean surface

children.value: Ocean surface is considered to be the top 100m

children.html: H=œÅC‚à´0zT(z)dzH = \rho C \int_0^z T(z) dzH=œÅC‚à´0z‚ÄãT(z)dz

children.value: Where H is ocean heat content, the value we are trying to calculate,

children.html: œÅ\rhoœÅ

children.value: is the density of sea water,

children.html: 1026kg/m31026 kg/m^31026kg/m3
CCC

children.value: is the specific heat of sea water,

children.html: 3990J/(kgK)3990 J/(kg K)3990J/(kgK)
zzz

children.value: is the depth limit of the calculation in meters,

children.html: T(z)T(z)T(z)

children.value: is the temperature at each depth in degrees Kelvin.

def calc_ocean_heat(delta_level, temperature):
    rho = 1026 #kg/m^3
    c_p = 3990 #J/(kg K)
    weighted_temperature = delta_level * temperature
    heat = weighted_temperature.sum(dim="z_t")*rho*c_p
    return heat

# Remember that the coordinate z_t still has values in cm
hist_temp_ocean_surface = hist_temp_in_degK.where(hist_temp_in_degK['z_t'] < 1e4,drop=True)
hist_temp_ocean_surface

Has the surface ocean heat content increased with time due to Global Warming ?
Let us plot the difference between the annual, ensemble mean heat content between the years 2014 and 1850 to check!

%%time
# Compute annual and ensemble mean
hist_oceanheat_ann_mean = hist_ocean_heat.mean('member_id').groupby('time.year').mean()
hist_oceanheat_ann_mean

children.value: Indeed! The surface ocean is trapping heat as the globe warms!

In this notebook we used sea temperature data from the Community Earth System Model (CESM2) Large Ensemble dataset to compute surface ocean heat and convince ourselves that the surface ocean is trapping extra heat as the globe warms. We used an intake-ESM catalog backed by pelican links to stream data from NCAR‚Äôs Geoscience Data Exchange via NCAR‚Äôs OSDF origin!
In the next notebook, we will see how to load data from multiple OSDF origins into a workflow. We will stream CMIP6 model data from AWS and observational data from NCAR‚Äôs GDEX.
(Community Earth System Model 2) hosted on NCAR‚Äôs GDEX.
